item.title: Pokemon Fan Shows Off Impressive Poke Flute Replica
item.description:
Summary

  • Poke Flute replica is hand-sculpted and will be a playable flute, resembling the original design.
  • Fans eagerly await the finished product, with many praising the progress and creativity.
  • Pokemon series items inspire fans to create unique and iconic replicas, reflecting their love for the franchise.

A Pokemon fan has shared the impressive Poke Flute replica they're working on, which will be a functioning, playable flute when they're done. The design does a great job of replicating how the original Poke Flute is depicted in the original games and anime, and Pokemon fans are excited to see how it develops.

The Poke Flute has been around since the original game, as well as the first season of the Pokemon anime. In the first generation Pokemon games, players will find that a Snorlax is blocking their path, and that there's no way to proceed around it. In order to get through, players have to gain a Poke Flute it and play it in front of the Snorlax, awakening it and triggering a battle. It was also usable in fights in the first-gen games and their remakes, and would wake up any sleeping Pokemon.

Now, a user on Reddit called xenpipes is sharing the impressive Poke Flute replica they're working on. The creation has been hand-sculpted out of clay, and is a perfect copy of the original design, looking like a recorder instrument with a Poke Ball near the bottom. While the design is incomplete, it already looks incredible, and according to xenpipes, it will be playable as a real flute once it's fired and finished. The finished piece would be an amazing thing to include in a Pokemon cosplay, especially if the cosplayer taught themselves how to play the tune that plays in the games.

Pokemon Fans are Eager to See More

Numerous users have responded to the post, and they seem to be impressed with xenpipes's work. Several had said that they're looking forward to both seeing and hearing the finished product, while others are more than impressed with the progress so far. One fan went so far as to say that Kurt, a Poke Ball smith first encountered in the second generation of games, would approve of the flute once it's completed.

With so many iconic items and objects coming out of the Pokemon series, it's no wonder that fans have an endless number of inspirations to draw from with pieces like this. Plenty of fans have made both perfect replicas of Poke Balls from the game as well as unique original Poke Ball designs, while others have brought things like the Pokedex or Pokemon GO 's Egg Incubators to the real world. Chances are that the series and its icons will continue to inspire fans all over the world for generations to come.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: Who Is Emperor Uriel Septim?
item.description:
Reigning from 368 to 433 of the Third Era, Uriel Septim was the last emperor to be crowned in the Septim line, as he would meet his death early in the events of The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion . Knowing his death would come shortly, Uriel VII freed the prisoner he had seen in his dreams, giving them the Amulet of Kings in the hope that it would prevent the oncoming Daedric invasion.

Though his reign was long at 65 years, it was fraught with plenty of turmoil. Despite being imprisoned, impersonated, indirectly responsible for a Dragonbreak, and finally murdered, Uriel was one of the most successful emperors of his line. Although he would meet his end early in Oblivion , Uriel’s legacy spans four mainline Elder Scrolls games, and is one of the most recognizable figures from the franchise.

What Happened During Uriel Septim’s Reign?

From the series' very inception, Uriel Septim has been involved in the plot of many of the games. In The Elder Scrolls: Arena , the very game in the series, Uriel is imprisoned by his Battlemage, Jagar Tharn, who impersonates him for ten years. During this period, known as the Imperial Simulacrum, the Empire falls into disarray, previously managed incredibly well by Uriel. It only ends when the Eternal Champion gathers all the fragments of the Staff of Chaos to defeat Tharn, freeing the real Uriel from his prison and exposing the impostor.

Later on, Uriel VII would send an Agent to Daggerfall to investigate the death of King Lysandus. What initially seemed like a simple murder mystery becomes a high-stakes gamble for control of High Rock by multiple players, ending in the Numidium, a walking brass god constructed by the Dwemer, causing a Dragonbreak. The Warp in the West, as it would become known, saw every possible end to the conflict to happen at the same time, causing plenty of contradictions in the Imperial timeline.

Uriel also became interested in the Nerevarine prophecy, and during the events of TES 3 , he would send the Nerevarine to Morrowind. Uriel seems to have had a history with releasing prisoners, as Oblivion begins when he releases the player character, the Hero of Kvatch, only moments before he is murdered by the Mythic Dawn.

With Uriel dead, and his sons dead too, the Septim line ends. Although Martin Septim would become emperor, he was never formally crowned, sacrificing himself to prevent Mehrunes Dagon from invading Tamriel. The period of relative stability that Uriel oversaw came to an end, and the Septim Empire never truly recovered, making way for the Great War with the Third Aldmeri Dominion in the Fourth Era.

Some Lesser Known Facts About Uriel Septim

Uriel Had an Imaginary Friend

When Uriel was young, he had an imaginary friend called Justin, who, despite the name, he always referred to as a girl. Justin would always have a place set for them at dinner in the Imperial Palace, and when Uriel grew older, his friends Symmachus and Barenziah would ask how Justin was. Uriel would play along, until one day, he informed them that Justin had met a Khajit boy and settled down with him in Lilandril, where they ran a small farm together.

He Was Only Distantly Related to Tiber Septim

Tiber Septim founded the Third Empire, leading to the beginning of the Third Age. While Uriel shares his last name with Tiber, he is only distantly related, as Tiber’s son Pelagius 1 died after ruling for only two years. In the succession crisis, Kintyra, the daughter of Tiber’s brother Agnorith, became empress, and Uriel descends from this branch of the family.

He Had Five Known Children, but Could Have Had More

In the opening of Oblivion, Uriel is informed that his three legitimate sons were attacked and presumably killed by the Mythic Dawn, but they were not the only ones. Martin Septim, an illegitimate son of Uriel, was not told he was the emperor’s son until the events of Oblivion, although he does not get to reconcile with this fact for long. The last known illegitimate son was Calaxes, who did know he was sired by Uriel, although he is dead by the time of TES 4 under suspicious circumstances, but these two may not be the only sons that Uriel tried to hide.

item.title: Roblox: Rebirth Champions Ultimate Codes (May 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Rebirth Champions Ultimate Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Rebirth Champions Ultimate
  • How to Get More Rebirth Champions Ultimate Codes

Rebirth Champions: Ultimate is one of the many popular pet collection games on Roblox and the premise is really quite simple. Players must repeatedly press their left mouse button to gain clicks, which they can then use to open eggs and get brand-new pets for their collection. The aim is ultimately to get the rarest pets possible while also racking up a huge amount of clicks.

In addition to purchasing upgrades, Roblox players can use items to increase the number of clicks they get each time they press their left mouse button. They can find these items around the map or purchase them from the store if they really want to, but the best way to get them is by redeeming Rebirth Champions: Ultimate codes.

Updated May 3, 2025, by Tom Bowen: Update 6 introduces the Brainrot Event, which includes a new world, pass, and boxes. It also added a new RCU code ( brainrot ), which players can redeem to get a bunch of in-game goodies. After doing so, they should bookmark this page so that they can check back here often, as we're constantly on the lookout for new Rebirth Champions Ultimate codes and will add any that we find to the list below.

Rebirth Champions Ultimate Codes

All Working Rebirth Champions Ultimate Codes

  • brainrot - Redeem code for one Apple, one Grape, and one Luck Potion (NEW)
  • spring - Redeem code for one Apple, one Grape, and one Luck Potion
  • easter - Redeem code for one Apple, one Grape, and one Luck Potion
  • heaven - Redeem code for one Apple, one Grape, and one Luck Potion
  • volcano - Redeem code for one Apple, one Grape, and one Luck Potion
  • cave - Redeem code for one Apple, one Grape, and one Luck Potion
  • @nCienTick3t - Redeem code for a free Ancient Ticket
  • Roksek - Redeem code for a free Fruits Box
  • release - Redeem code for one Apple, one Grape, and one Luck Potion

All Expired Rebirth Champions Ultimate Codes

  • There are currently no expired codes for Rebirth Champions: Ultimate

How to Redeem Codes in Rebirth Champions Ultimate

Before players can redeem Rebirth Champions: Ultimate codes, they'll first need to complete the tutorial and purchase the Rebirth Buttons upgrade from the blue upgrades beacon near the center of the map. After that, the process isn't too different from the ones found in other Roblox games. For those having trouble, though, the following step-by-step instructions should come in handy.

  1. Launch Rebirth Champions: Ultimate .
  2. Complete the tutorial and unlock the Rebirth Buttons upgrade.
  3. Press the shopping basket button on the left side of the screen.
  4. Scroll down to the bottom of the store page and then type or paste a working Rebirth Champions: Ultimate code into the white codes box.
  5. Press enter or click the green arrow button to the right of the codes box to redeem the code.

How to Get More Rebirth Champions Ultimate Codes

The easiest way to keep up to date with all of the latest Rebirth Champions Ultimate codes is to bookmark this page and check back here regularly, as we'll update the list above whenever new Roblox codes become available. Those who'd rather get their codes straight from the dev team may also want to follow the devs' social pages and join the game's official Roblox group.

  • Powerful Studio Discord Server
  • Powerful Studio Roblox Group
  • Powerful Studio Twitter Account

item.title: Monopoly GO: Pod Racers Event Guide
item.description:
Monopoly GO has kicked off May with a bang. The new Star Wars GO sticker album has finally arrived, and along with it comes a brand-new racing minigame called Pod Racers.

The Pod Racers event started on May 1 and will run until May 5 . There’s a bunch of cool items up for grabs, like different kinds of sticker packs, a new board skin, and more. So if you are wondering what rewards are available and how to play the minigame, don’t worry. Let’s break it all down.

Pod Racers Rewards In Monopoly GO

Rank

Pod Racers Rewards (For Teams)

Pod Racers Rewards (Solo Players)

1st

Jabba the Hutt Board Token, Five-Star Sticker Pack, Pit Droid Shield Skin

Jabba the Hutt Board Token, Four-Star Sticker Pack, Pit Droid Shield Skin

2nd

Four-Star Sticker Pack, Three-Star Sticker Pack, Pit Droid Shield Skin

Three-Star Sticker Pack, Pit Droid Shield Skin

3rd

Three-Star Sticker Pack, Two-Star Sticker Pack, Pit Droid Shield Skin

Three-Star Sticker Pack

4th

Two-Star Sticker Pack, One-Star Sticker Pack

Two-Star Sticker Pack

How To Play Pod Racers Monopoly GO

Pod Racers has its own special currency called Flag tokens. Without them, your car isn’t going anywhere, so you will need to collect them to participate.

There’s a dice popper in the event that you have to roll to move your car on the race track. Each roll costs 20 Flag tokens. The number your dice land on decides how far your car moves. If you want to move faster, you should use the multiplier. It increases how far you go and helps you earn more points, but keep in mind that it also uses up more Flag Tokens.

Pod Racers is mainly a team event, but Monopoly GO fans can also play it solo if they want. Having said that, the solo rewards aren’t as exciting. If you team up, you can win the grand reward of a purple sticker pack, the Jabba the Hutt token, and a Pit Droid shield skin . But if you go solo, you will just get a four-star pack instead. But don’t worry because the token and shield skin stay the same whether you play solo or with a team.

On top of the main rewards, players will also earn lap rewards as they make their way around the track. When you complete a lap, the game might give you a little bonus. You’ll get to pick from a few options like dice rolls, sticker packs, or more Flag tokens to help you keep racing.

Players will be competing in three races during the event, and your final score will decide who wins. The last race gives the most points, so make sure to save your Flag tokens for it.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Is Giving Away Free Items
item.description:
Summary

  • Players can redeem a code for free hourglasses and trade tokens in Pokemon TCG Pocket until May 27.
  • Use hourglasses to open extra booster packs and trade tokens for trading cards based on rarity.

Pokemon TCG Pocket has revealed a new code for players to exchange for a pack of hourglasses and trade tokens. According to the Pokemon TCG Pocket development team, the freebies are to celebrate Golden Week, a popular holiday period in Japan that runs from April 29 to May 5.

Bringing the physical Pokemon Trading Card Game to mobile devices, Pokemon TCG Pocket was released by deNA in October last year. The game attracts competitive players who exchange tips on decks and strategies as well as more casual players who focus on collecting cards. To do this, everyone needs to obtain cards either by opening packs or making trades. Helping the community in their quest to get their favorite cards, the devs have released two freebies that players won't want to miss.

Pokemon TCG Pocket has released a new gift code: S5N4NDM00N . With it, Pokemon TCG Pocket players can claim a pack with 24 hourglasses and 500 tokens free of charge. Users must access the specific site for claim codes, entering the one given by the devs, and insert their ID. To obtain the ID, players must open the game and, on the title screen, tap on the icon with three horizontal bars located at the top right, finding the ID at the bottom of the screen that will then appear. Players should stay alert, however, as the code to get more hourglasses and trade tokens can be claimed until May 27 at 7:59 am.

How Players Can Use Hourglass Packs and Trade Tokens in Pokemon TCG Pocket?

  • New Pokemon TCG Pocket gift code: S5N4NDM00N

Players can open two booster packs a day for free, but using Pokemon TCG Pocket's hourglasses, they can open even more. While the next free pack is on cooldown, by spending a number of hourglasses equivalent to the time remaining, they can open one or 10 packs in a single go. Meanwhile, trade tokens are an essential part of trading Pokemon TCG Pocket cards, an anticipated feature developers added at the beginning of 2025. Players spend tokens proportional to the card rarity they wish to trade.

The freebies provided by deNA come just a few days after the release of Celestial Guardians, the newest Pokemon TCG Pocket expansion. With over 200 cards for players to collect, some stand out, such as Guzma and Lillie, the first Trainer cards to get an immersive variant. The set has other highlights, such as the Alola starters, ex variants of the Solgaleo and Lunala legendaries, and the addition of shiny new Pokemon. This card variant was introduced in the previous mini-set, and now players have more options to pull, such as shiny Gengar ex, Blastoise ex, and Wigglytuff ex.

Experience the fun of collecting Pokémon Trading Card Game (TCG) cards with Pokémon Trading Card Game Pocket, an upcoming game for iOS and Android devices from Creatures Inc., the original developers of the Pokémon TCG, and DeNA Co., Ltd. In this game, you will be able to open two booster packs every day at no cost. You can collect digital cards featuring nostalgic artwork from the past as well as brand-new cards that are exclusive to Pokémon Trading Card Game Pocket.

Be on the lookout for new “immersive cards,” which will make you feel as though you’ve leapt into the world of the card’s illustration.
